qas.question: When did CBC shut down its analogue transmitter?
Which CBC location has a lapsed area of coverage after 2010?
Which US city can receive broadcasts from CBC's London transmitter?
What location in the United States has the highest viewership of CBC programming?

plausible_answers.text: shut down its analogue transmitter and decided not to replace it with a digital transmitter

qas.question: What has caused the ratings of the CBC to lapse since September 2010?

plausible_answers.text: there is now a giant hole in the coverage of CBC in South-Western Ontario.

qas.question: Economic conditions and societal inequality has caused the CBC to ignore this problem?
What is the maximum distance that a city can be from a transmission antenna?

context: CBC Television stations can be received in many United States communities along the Canadian border over-the-air and have a significant audience in those areas. Such a phenomenon can also take place within Great Lakes communities such as <a2_0><b3_0>Ashtabula, Ohio<b3_0/><a2_0/>, which received programming from the CBC's London, Ontario, transmitter, based upon prevailing atmospheric conditions over Lake Erie. As of <a0_0>September 2010<a0_0/> CBC <b4_0>shut down its analogue transmitter and decided not to replace it with a digital transmitter<b4_0/>. As a result, <b5_0>there is now a giant hole in the coverage of CBC in <a1_0>South-Western Ontario<a1_0/>.<b5_0/> Both CBC - Toronto and CBC - Windsor are both over <b6_0>100 miles<b6_0/> from London, ON and out of range for even the largest antennas[citation needed].
